byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva. Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow.
byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

abstract: World Health Organization says bombardment of rebel-held eastern Aleppo by Syrian government and Russian allies has resulted in 338 deaths, including killing of over 100 children; experts warn lack of medical treatment will lead to deaths of many of 846 wounded.
lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization said it feared many more would die from lack of treatment at hospitals destroyed or damaged by the government’s airstrikes.
snippet: The World Health Organization said it feared many more would die from lack of treatment at hospitals destroyed or damaged by the government’s airstrikes....

headline.main: Over 100 Children Among 338 Killed in Aleppo Attacks This Week, W.H.O. Says
headline.print_headline: Over 100 Children Were Killed in Week of Aleppo Attacks, W.H.O. Says
